text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zimbabwe press on Wednesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Tritel, Econet and Supercell, which all lost out to Telecel in the tender bid for Zimbabwe's second cellular phone network licence, have formally complained to the Tender Board on the way the tender was conducted.
- At least 40 Zimbabwean passports are reported stolen a day, mostly from Zimbabweans visiting neighbouring South Africa.
- A clinical psychiatrist has told a regional court in the trial of three drug traffickers that recent research had failed to establish conclusively that mbanje (marijuana) caused brain damage.
- Electricity consumers in Zimbabwe's capital Harare now owe the Zimbabwe Electricity Supply Authority about Z$111 million in payment defaults.
